subject: History
title: The Shroud of Turin
description: One-minute skill: The Shroud of Turin.

hook.text: A linen cloth in Turin bears the faint image of a crucified man. Millions believe it wrapped Jesus. Science isn't sure.

buildup.text: The Shroud shows a full-body image with wounds matching the biblical crucifixion account in precise detail.

discovery.text: In 1988, radiocarbon dating placed the cloth between 1260 and 1390 ADâ€”medieval, not ancient.

twist.text: Defenders argue the tested sample was from a medieval repair patch, not the original cloth. The debate rages on.

climax.text: No one has explained how the image was created. It has 3D properties no medieval artist could have produced.

punchline.text: Science can date it but can't explain it.

quiz.question: What did radiocarbon dating reveal about the Shroud of Turin?
options: It dates to the first century AD, matching Jesus's time
It dates to the medieval period, between 1260 and 1390 AD
The results were inconclusive due to contamination
